item.name: Request Header
item.description:
The request header supports Request-Key,App-Id & App-Key parameters that are common across all '/v2' and '/auth/v2' endpoints; as a result, the header parameters aren’t documented with each endpoint.  
In Sikka API , user can send request key , app id and app key as url parameter also.  
If user does not want to expose keys in url parameter then we do support send keys in request header.

List of response headers:

| Request Header | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `Request-Key` | Request-Key header supports in all '/v2' APIs |
| `App-Id` | App-Id. Application id header supported in all '/auth/v2' api or where it is required |
| `App-Key` | App-Key. Application Key header supported in all '/auth/v2' api or where it is required |

item.name: Response Header
item.description:
The headers contain a wealth of information that can help you track request and related information. HTTP Headers are an important part of the API request and response as they represent the meta-data associated with the API request and response.

List of response headers:

| Response Header | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `Data-Insert:` | 'data-insert‘ response header let API user know the status of data insert status. User should not fetch data when data insert is in progress. ‘data-insert’ header will help API users to know if data insert is in progress or not. |
|  | `Data-Insert: completed` - data insert completed, good to fetch data. |
|  | `Data-Insert: in progress`\- data insert is in progress, wait till data insert completed |
|  | APIs has ‘data-insert’ header : transactions , patients , guarantors_v2 , patients_v2 , treatment_plans , appointments , patient_contract_roll_charges |
| `Request-Key-Expires: GMT` | If 'request_key' is active then 'Request-Key-Expires' value will be request_start_time + 24 hours, if 'request_key' is expired or inactive then request_end_time used as 'Request-Key-Expires'. `http-date format (e.g. Wed, 21 Aug 2019 17:19:33 GMT)` |
|  | 'Request-Key-Expires' header will be available in all APIs where request_key is used. |

item.name: Webhooks
item.description:
Webhooks allow you to set up your Apps which subscribe to certain events on practice data or Sikka Platform Cloud. When one of those events is triggered, we'll send a HTTP POST payload to the webhook's configured URL. Webhooks can be used to update your production server or CI builds and let you know about latest activity.  
Once webhook configured , the webhook will be triggered each time one or more subscribed events occurs.  
You can create up to 2 webhooks for each event on each target

> ![](https://api.sikkasoft.com/portal/images/webhook-1.png)
> 
> ![](https://api.sikkasoft.com/portal/images/webhook-2.png)

Webhooks require a few configuration options before you use of them.

## Payload URL

This is your server endpoint that will receive the webhook payload.  
For example , you want to received events on  
`https:///api/receieve_payload`  
Or  
`https:///api/payload`

## Content Type

At current Sikka Webhooks can be delivered using json format:  
The `application/json` content type will deliver the JSON payload directly as the body of the POST.

## Events

When configuring a webhook, you can choose which events you would like to receive payloads for. Only subscribing to the specific events you plan on handling is useful for limiting the number of HTTP requests to your server. You can change the list of subscribed events through the UI anytime.  
Each event corresponds to a certain set of actions that can happen to practice data or Sikka Platform Cloud.  
For example, if you subscribe to the Data Refresh event you'll receive detailed payloads every time when Sikka Practice Utility data refresh completed  
To create webhook , log in to [Sikka API portal](https://api.sikkasoft.com). Click on `webhook`. Enter required information and click on `Add Webhook`, it's time to check on your server to test the if events are receiving or not.

The available events are :

| Name | Description |
| --- | --- |
| `Data_Refresh` | This indicates local SPC refresh is completed and data be available via API |
| `patient` | When practice chang patient records , new patient added or deleted , this event will trigger. |
| `transaction` | When practice chang transaction records , new transaction added or deleted , this event will trigger. |
| `appointments` | When practice chang appointments records , new appointments added or deleted , this event will trigger. |

> Note : Sikka Practice Utility has to be up and running on server for all events

## Payloads

Each event type has a specific payload format with the relevant event information.  
In addition to the fields documented for each event, webhook payloads include the office_id , practice_id on which the event occurred on

### Headers

`HTTP POST` payloads that are delivered to your webhook's configured URL endpoint will contain several headers:  
Example delivery

```
POST /payload HTTP/1.1
Host: 
callback-key: xxxxxxxxx
Content-Type: application/json
Content-Length: 6615
{
 BODY
}

```

### Webhook payload example

#### Data_refresh :

```
{
  "event": "Data_Refresh",
  "office_id": "D24710",
  "practice_id": 1,
  "prev_generated_time": "2019-12-09 14:37:56",
  "next_data_synchronization_date": "2019-12-10 17:15:00",
  "spc_schedule_interval": "25 Minutes",
  "data_synchronization_date": "2018-04-04 17:03:07",
  "practice_management_system_refresh_date": "2018-04-04 17:01:21",
  "financial_system_refresh_date": "1111-11-11",
  "web_upload_date": "2018-04-04 17:03:07",
  "data_insert_date": "2018-04-04 17:11:34",
  "practice_management_system_refresh_date_time_zone": "Eastern Standard Time",
  "practice_management_system": "Dentrix",
  "practice_management_system_version": "V16.6",
  "financial_system": "",
  "financial_system_version": "",
  "utc_difference_in_minutes": "240",
  "spc_schedule_time": "5:00 PM",
  "spc_schedule_type": "Daily"
}

```

#### Patient :

```
{
  "event": "patient",
  "office_id": "D20226",
  "practice_id": "1",
  "prev_generated_time": "2019-12-09 14:37:56",
  "next_data_synchronization_date": "2019-12-10 17:15:00",
  "generated_time": "2018-04-04 17:06:00"
}

```

### Sikka Webhook Retry Policies

A retry policy is the process that will take over if/when one of your post back url requests fail .

#### When Do We Retry?

We will retry anytime we do not receive what we consider a successful response from the destination server. Below is a list of HTTP status codes that we consider as successes/failures.

Response Retry

*   200 - success
*   201 - success
*   202 -success
*   204 - success
*   3xx - failure
*   4xx - failure
*   5xx - failure
*   Time out - failure
    

| Attempt | Webhook Notification will be delivered at |
| --- | --- |
| 0 - This is the initial delivery attempt | Immediately |
| 1 - Delivery failed once, this is the second attempt | failure attempt count =1 |
| 2 - Delivery failed twice, this is the third attempt | failure attempt count = 2 |
| 3 - This is the third attempt | failure attempt count = 3 |
| 4 - This is the fourth attempt | failure attempt count = 4 |
| 5 - This is the fifth attempt | failure attempt count = 5 |
| After 5th failure attempt , webhook status will be inactive and will not send any notification |  |

item.name: Practice Query Language
item.description:
##### Benefits and Limitations

There are many benefits to using dynamic query ( PQL ) on API endpoints , for both the business and developers. However, there are limitations as well. In order to benefit from getting flexible schemas and result in API response, applications must share responsibility for managing the schema and the integrity of data

###### Benefits

*   Faster time to market: No learning curve ( for developers ) & Easy implementation.
*   Easier development: Build applications and features using simpler queries on Sikka APIs.
*   Less risk: Tightly integrated with licensing , so there will be no unauthorized access of data points
*   Limitations
*   Data models: Complex queries are not supported. Right now you can join maximum 5 APIs in single PQL.
*   Limited APIs: Not all APIs are queryable. Check API document for API list.
    

##### Use Cases

With dynamic query, APIs can support modern use cases for mission-critical applications, or simplify existing use cases, by combining the flexibility of dynamic query on APIs.

*   Review Management: Get list of patients visited to practice in one API call.
*   Finance: Get accounts receivables information off patients and guarantors.
*   IoT: Devices needed many possible information combination can use PQL to get dynamic data.
*   Scheduling : Using PQL get the different combination of appointment scheduling and build app on top of that.
    

##### List of Sikka API support to PQL

You can use below Sikka APIs in PQL

*   Practices
*   Transactions
*   Appointments
*   Providers
*   Patients
*   Guarantors_v2
*   Veterinary_patients
*   Treatment_plans
*   Claims
*   Insurance_companies
    

##### Architecture

![](https://api.sikkasoft.com/portal/images/PQL-0.png)

##### Get data from different APIs

‘Practice_query’ ( PQL ) API allows you to run query on Sikka API and get result.  
For example :  
Get the list of patient (with patient & appointment details ) who had appointment on ‘2017-05-30’.  
If you use regular API then you have to call ‘patients’ and ‘appointments’ API. Using ‘practice_query’ ( PQL ), get data and merge it on client side

![](https://api.sikkasoft.com/portal/images/PQL-1.png)

##### How to use ‘PQL’ in Sikka API testing tool

###### Response :

![](https://api.sikkasoft.com/portal/images/PQL-5.png)

Welcome to Sikka API. Here you will find the step-by-step guide that will help you build an application on the Sikka Platform and full listing of all the available APIs. As we add more APIs, they will automatically documented here and available to you as per your API plan. For more information about a particular endpoint, click on its name. You will be taken to the API’s documentation page, which includes what query parameters the API will accept, what the JSON or XML parameters will be in the response, and an example.

###### Follow Below Steps

*   Step 1 : Register an app with Sikka
*   Step 2 : Add clients to your app
*   Step 3 : Get an authorization
*   Step 4 : Install SPC (Sikka Platform Cloud)
*   Step 5 : Fetching and displaying data
    

> ###### What developers need to do?
> 
> ![](https://api.sikkasoft.com/portal/images/DeveloperAppFlow.png)

> ###### What your clients need to do to display data?
> 
> ![](https://api.sikkasoft.com/portal/images/ClientAppFlow.png)

> ### Prerequisite
> 
> To fetch the data you will need to add practice to your app. SPC (Sikka Platform Cloud) must be installed on practice to fetch the data.

### Step 1 : Register an app with Sikka

Register an App with Sikka

Please provide all necessary information about your App. It will help us to authorize your app.

After successful App registration you will get an application id and application key. Keep these keys safe as it will require to fetch the data from practice.

> Note : Do not disclose your keys.

### Step 2 : Add clients to your app

Contact sikka software API team for detail information.

### Step 3 : Get an authorization

<!-- - We do support oAuth 2.0 

oAuth 2.0 is a protocol that lets your app access the practice details in a Sikka account without getting their password.

You'll need to register your app before getting started. A registered app is assigned a unique Application ID (Client ID) and Application Secret Key (Client Secret) which will be used in the OAuth flow. The Application ID and Application Secret Key should not be shared.

Sign in with Sikka ( You will find the url in API portal, under 'Application Details' as 'authorization link') is the best way to log individual user into your application.

###### The oAuth Flow

###### Step 1 - Authorization

Your web or mobile app should redirect users to the following URL:

[https://api.sikkasoft.com/portal/authapp.aspx?response_type=code&client_id=APPLICATION_ID&redirect_uri=REDIRECT_URI&scope=*&state=123456](https://api.sikkasoft.com/portal/authapp.aspx?response_type=code&client_id=APPLICATION_ID&redirect_uri=REDIRECT_URI&scope=*&state=123456)

The following values should be passed as GET parameters:

*   client_id = Issued when you created your app (Application ID). (required)
*   response_type = code - Indicates that your server expects to receive an authorization code. (required)
*   redirect_uri = Indicates the URI to return the user to after authorization is complete. (optional)
*   scope = GLOBAL - It allows you to access client information based on your API licenses. (required)
*   state = A random string generated by your application, which you'll verify later. This parameter’s value should be an anti-forgery token to protect against cross-site request forgery (CSRF). (optional)
    

###### Step 2 - Allow Access

After successful login user sees the authorization prompt

![](https://api.sikkasoft.com/portal/images/Authorization_new.png)

If the user clicks "Allow", the service redirects the user back to redirect_uri site with an auth code. Sikka API server generate random AUTH_CODE.

[https://redirect_uri?code=AUTH_CODE_HERE&state=123456](https://redirect_uri?code=AUTH_CODE_HERE&state=123456)

*   code = The server returns the authorization code in the query string.
*   state = The server returns the same state value that client passed.
    

**What developer/ API user should do ?**

Developer should first compare this state value to ensure it matches the one you started with. You can typically store the state value in a cookie or session, and compare it when the user comes back. This ensures your redirection endpoint isn't able to be tricked into attempting to exchange arbitrary authorization codes.

**Storing tokens and credentials**

Store your application's credentials and user tokens with care.

**Redirect URIs**

The redirect_uri parameter is optional. If left out, it will redirect users to the callback URL configured in your app's settings. If provided, the redirect URL's host and port must exactly match the callback URL. The redirect URL's path must reference a subdirectory of the callback URL.

CALLBACK: [http://example.com/path](http://example.com/path)

**GOOD**: [https://example.com/path](https://example.com/path)

**GOOD**: [http://example.com/path/subdir/other](http://example.com/path/subdir/other)

###### Step 3 - Token( request_key ) Issuing

If the user authorizes your app, Sikka will redirect back to your specified redirect_uri with a temporary code in a code GET parameter, as well as a state parameter if you provided one in the previous step. If the states don't match, the request may have been created by a third party and you should abort the process.

Your server exchanges the auth code for an access token:

**Sample request :**

``` javascript
POST https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/token
Content-Type : application/json
{
"grant_type":"authorization_code",
"code":"AUTH_CODE_HERE",
"redirect_uri":"REDIRECT_URI",
"client_id":"APPLICATION ID",
"client_secret":"APPLICATION SECRET KEY"
}

```

*   grant_type = authorization_code - The grant type for this flow is authorization_code.
*   code = AUTH_CODE_HERE - This is the code you received in the query string.
*   redirect_uri = REDIRECT_URI - Must be identical to the redirect URI provided in the original link.
*   client_id = CLIENT_ID - The Application ID you received when you first created the application.
*   client_secret = Application secret key - Since this request is made from server-side code, the secret is included.  
    The server replies with an access token and expiration time \[Please note here: 'access_token' and 'request_key' are same.\]
    

**Response :**

``` javascript
{ 
"scope": "https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/",
"access_token": "d25c47ca453a42bc9133d76b1719eb18",
"request_key": "d25c47ca453a42bc9133d76b1719eb18",
"token_type": "Bearer",
"expires_in": "86400"
"refresh_token":"01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef"
}

```

**Token refresh**

Access tokens/request_keys expire 24 hours after they are issued. The refresh token can be used to make a request for a new access token/request_key, similar to the initial access token exchange. Refresh tokens don’t expire until you delete refresh token.

**Sample Request :**

``` javascript
POST https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/token
Content-Type =Application/json
{
"grant_type":"refresh_token",
"refresh_token":"01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef",
"client_id":"application id",
"client_secret":"Application Secret Key"
}

```

**Response :**

``` javascript
{ 
"scope": "https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/",
"access_token": "d25c47ca453a42bc9133d76b1719eb18",
"request_key": "d25c47ca453a42bc9133d76b1719eb18",
"token_type": "Bearer",
"expires_in": "86400"
"refresh_token":"01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef"
}

```

**Revoking tokens**

If you want to dispose of an oAuth token, use delete refresh_token.

By revoking the last token associated between your application and a user, your application will not be able to access practice data.

DELETE [https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/refresh_token/{refresh_token}?client_id={client_id}&client_secret={client_secret}](https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/refresh_token/{refresh_token}?client_id={client_id}&client_secret={client_secret})

*   refresh_token = oAuth refresh_token you want to revoke. (required)
*   client_id = Application id - Issued when you created your app (Application ID). (required)
*   client_secret = Application secret key - Since this request is made from server-side code, the secret is included.
    
-->

To get an authorization from practice or on boarding new practice your application has to be published on sikka marketplace.

How to check if application is published ?

> ![](https://api.sikkasoft.com/portal/images/marketplace-1.png)

> *   Step 1. Click on marketplace published url
> *   Step 2. Register practice

### Step 4 : Install SPC

Download and Install SPC (Sikka Platform Cloud)

> ##### Prerequisite

> SPC should be install on practice management system server. In short SPC and practice management system should be on same machine  
> SPC will require username and password for sikka account

### Step 5 : Fetching and displaying data

To fetch the data via Sikka API you will need request key. Sample API request to generate request key

Request

[https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/start?app_id={appid}&app_key={appkey}&office_id={officeid}&secret_key={secret_key}](https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/start?app_id={appid}&app_key={appkey}&office_id={officeid}&secret_key={secret_key})

Response

``` javascript
{
"scope": " https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/ "
"request_key":"xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx"
"token_type":"xxxxxx",
"expires_in":"24 hours"
}

```

For more information about a particular endpoint, go to API v2.0 documentation. You will be taken to the API’s documentation page, which includes what query parameters the API will accept, what the JSON or XML parameters will be in the response, and an example.

request.description:
‘health_check’ API provides detailed information about SPC and machine, SPC is installed on. 
It contains error log information , PMS , machine , SPC and data synchronization dates 

|Parameter|Description|Required|
|---|---|---|
|app_id|This is the ID assigned to the application when the application is registered on API portal|Yes|
|app_key|This is the unique key generated when the application is registered on API portal|Yes|
|office_id|Mastercustomerid, This is the ID assigned to a practice when that practice is added|No|
|spc_id|spc_id|No|
|practice_id|practice_id|No|
|spc_version|spc_version|No|
|practice_management_system|practice_management_system|No|
|practice_management_system_version|practice_management_system_version|No|
|spc_schedule_type|spc_schedule_type|No|
|web_upload_error_priority|web_upload_error_priority|No|
|domain|domain|No|
|spc_error_priority|spc_error_priority|No|
|spc_error_flag|spc_error_flag|No|
|etl_version|etl_version|No|
|isinactive|isinactive|No|

##### API response contains below information 

| SPC information      |  |  |
| ----------- | ----------- |---------|
| office_id  | spc_id       | practice_id
| refresh_time   | spc_version        | spc_schedule_time
| spc_schedule_type   | spc_schedule_interval        | is_spc_update_locked
| spc_update_lock_note   | last_spc_updated_checked        | is_delta_import_enable
| domain   | spc_error_flag        | spc_error_priority
| spc_error_description   | timezone        | isinactive


| ETL information     |       |  |
|---------------------|----------------------------------|----------------------------------|
| etl_start           | etl_error_priority               | local_insert_error_priority      |
| etl_end             | etl_error_description            | local_insert_cpu_utilization     |
| web_upload_start    | etl_cpu_utilization              | local_insert_memory_utilization  |
| web_upload_end      | etl_memory_utilization           | local_upload_error_description   |
|  | financial_error_priority         | web_upload_error_flag            |
|    | financial_error_description      | web_upload_error_priority        |
| financial_etl_start | financial_etl_cpu_utilization    | web_upload_bandwidth_utilization |
| financial_etl_end   | financial_etl_memory_utilization | web_upload_error_description     |
| etl_error_log       | local_insert_error_log           | upload_to_server                 |
| upload_to_client    |                 |                  |
| etl_version         |                       |                       |


| PMS information                                         |
|---------------------------------------------|
| practice_management_system                  |
| practice_management_system_version          |
| practice_management_system_version_detected |
| practice_management_system_data_path        |
| DetectedPMSVersion                          |
| PMSDataPath                                 |
| PMSDatabaseName                             |


| Financial System Information                                      |
|----------------------------------------------|
| financial_management_system                  |
| financial_management_system_version          |
| financial_management_system_version_detected |
| financial_management_system_data_path        |


| Teamviwer         |
|-------------------|
| teamviwer_id      |
| teamviwer_version |



##### When you should use ‘health_check’ API ?

>  If you want to build SPC support portal and monitor SPC & ETL health.
    
>  Check SPC information. SPC should be active , there should be no error & refresh time should be current ( based on SPC schedule type setting )
    
>  In case of error or data is not updated , first check SPC_error_flag , spc_error_description
    
>  For more details you can check ETL information & PMS information ( start & end time , error description , notes , priority etc. )


For example, report SPC error codes and descriptions that will direct you to the cause. It may indicate that the PMS Version detected seems to be different from what is configured. Or it will tell you the last time we heard from that SPC, or what version it is, how much of the cpu is being used for the refresh, how much memory there is, the version of the OS, it’s IP addresses and more.

request.description:
Return the list of practices & your application has authorized to access data

|Parameter|Description|Required|
|---|---|---|
|app_id|This is the ID assigned to the application when the application is registered on API portal|Yes|
|app_key|This is the unique key generated when the application is registered on API portal|Yes|
|practice_management_system_refresh_date_time_zone|Time Zone|No
|show|Possible value for this parameter is "all" to show all practices|No|
|practice_id|Practice ID, only works when show=all used|No|
|practice_name|Practice Name|No|

|Field | Note |
|------|-------|
|`office_id` | Unique office id in Sikka system. This will require in `start` API call|
|`secret_key` | Unique secret key of office in Sikka system. This will require in `start` API call|
|`domain` | domain / vertical of practice|
|`practice_name` | Name of practice when user signed up for Sikka account |
|`practice_management_system`| Practice management system of practice.| 
|`financial_system`| Financial system of practice when user signed up for Sikka account |
|`practice_management_system_refresh_date`| This date indicates when SPC has sync. with practice management system.This is local time as per practice location. see below `practice_management_system_refresh_date_time_zone`  |
|`data_synchronization_date`| This date indicates when SPC has sync. with sikka cloud database. This is local time as per practice location. see below `practice_management_system_refresh_date_time_zone`  |
|`data_insert_date`| This date indicates when practice management system data inserted into sikka cloud database.This date shows latest data updated date. This is local time as per practice location. see below `practice_management_system_refresh_date_time_zone`  |
|`practice_management_system_refresh_date_time_zone`| Time zone of practice location. |
|`practice_id` | practice_id(Location ID) of the practice for office id in Sikka system. |

> To make sure practice data is updated or not : check `data_insert_date` . if `data_insert_date` is latest or greater then last data insert date that means practice data is updated successfully. If `data_insert_date` is old or not changing please refresh SPC on client location.

Generate the request keys. This API is same as `start` API call . Both are same


|Parameter	|Description	|Required?|
|---|---|---|
|app_id	|This is the ID assigned to the application when the application is registered on API portal|	Yes|
|app_key|	This is the unique key generated when the application is registered on API portal	|Yes|

|secret_key|	This is the Secrete Key generated for that practice, when practice is added	|Yes|

item.name: list of all request keys made by application

request.description:
Accepts application id and application key and returns information about all the API calls made by application in last 24 hrs. It contains request keys , api name , response time , data size , time , request status , parameters , response time per request_key.

|Parameter	|Description	|Required?|
|---|---|---|
|app_id	|This is the ID assigned to the application when the application is registered on API portal|	Yes|
|app_key|	This is the unique key generated when the application is registered on API portal	|Yes|

The `reset_password` API is used to change the password, after getting the verification code. After app request API to send verification code.In next step user should pass encrypted verification code and encrypted new password via `reset_password` API. This API will check for verification code and if it is correct then changes the password to the new one, or error message will be given. After password change user can log in with new password.

|Parameter	|Description	|Required?|
|---|---|---|
|app_id	|This is the ID assigned to the application when the application is registered on API portal|	Yes|
|app_key|	This is the unique key generated when the application is registered on API portal	|Yes|
|account_type|	provider or patient	|Yes|
|pw|	Password. Use this parameter's value after encryption. please check the encrypt API call to encrypt value.	|Yes|
|email|	Email id of patient / provider	|Yes|
|vcode|	verification code. Encrypt verification code before passing to request	|Yes|
|encrypted|	Encrypted is string variable. It can be “true” or “false”. Default value is “true”. If you want to send encrypted username , password , verification code then set encrypted=true otherwise for plain text set it encrypted=false	|No|

response.name: request
response.body: {"http_code":"200","http_code_desc":"OK","sikka_status_code":"API4001","short_message":"","long_message":" Password changed successfully. You can login with new password.","more_information":""}

request.description:

|Parameter	|Description	|Required?|
|---|---|---|
|app_id	|This is the ID assigned to the application when the application is registered on API portal|	Yes|
|app_key|	This is the unique key generated when the application is registered on API portal	|Yes|
To change or reset the Sikka account password. First you need to send the verification code to user. User will receive the  verification code and you can use that code in `reset_password` API

response.name: request
response.body: {"http_code":"200","http_code_desc":"OK","sikka_status_code":"API4001","short_message":"","long_message":"Verification code sent to 'demo@sikkasoftware.com'. Please check your inbox for code.","more_information":""}

request.description:
**When to use this api ?**
In case of multi location practice and in Sikka API if all providers are showing under one location , in that case 'practice_resources' api helps to map providers and other entities with location

**id:**
It will depend on the resource. If the resource is provider then it will be provider id from provider

**resource:**
It will help us to find out which resource the id belongs to.

**practice_id:**
Associated practice id.

**common_resource:**
If T then that resource is available for all the practices. If F then that resource is available for that specific practice location.  

|Parameter|Description|Required?|
|--- |--- |--- |
|request_key|Valid 32 characters alpha-numeric request key|Yes|
|practice_id|Practice ID|No|
|id|id as per the response|No|
|resource| resource is api name |No|

**SortBy**

|Parameter|Description|
|--- |--- |
|practice_id|Practice ID|
|resource|resource is api name|

|practice_id|Practice ID|No|

request.description:
patients_v2 is same as patients API except ‘last_transaction_date’. ‘Last_transaction_date’ is additional field in ‘patients_v2’ API. This API has been introduced to improve ‘last_visit’ filter and return data based on ‘last_visit’ date. how 'last_visit' filter work : i.e for last_visit = 2016-09-28 filter last_visit= '2016-09-28' OR (last_visit= ' ' AND first_visit= '2016-09-28') OR last_transaction_date = '2016-09-28'

|Parameter|Description|Required?|
|--- |--- |--- |
|request_key|Valid 32 characters alpha-numeric request key|Yes|
|email|Email id of patient / provider|No|
|guarantor_id|Guarantor id as per practice management systems|No|
|provider_id|Provider id as per practice management system|No|
|patient_id|Patient ID as per the management system|No|
|firstname|First name of patient, provider or guarantor|No|
|practice_id|Practice ID|No|
|lastname|Last name of patient, provider or guarantor|No|
|last_visit|Last Visit|No|
|cell|Cell Number|No|
|search|Search patient by firstname , lastname , email , middlename, city, state, zipcode, homephone, workphone, cell|No|
|status|Status of patient|No|
|phone|Phone Number|No|

**SortBy**

|Parameter|Description|
|--- |--- |
|patient_id|Patient ID as per the management system|
|firstname|First name of patient, provider or guarantor|
|lastname|Last name of patient, provider or guarantor|
|zipcode|Zipcode|

request.description:
This API will return key performance indicator's data based on date range and practice id passed. 

Sample response is attached for 'Accounts Receivable' API.

`
https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/kpis/Accounts Receivable?request_key={request_key}&startdate={start date}&enddate={end date}
`

|Parameter|Description|Required?|
|--- |--- |--- |
|request_key|Valid 32 characters alpha-numeric request key|Yes|
|key_performance_indicator| key_performance_indicator as per 'kpis' endpoint response | Yes |
|startdate| key performance indicator data start date.Date format : yyyy-mm-dd | Yes |
|enddate| key performance indicator data end date.Date format : yyyy-mm-dd | Yes |
|practice_id| Practice ID | No |

response.name: request

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Methods
header.value: GET, POST, OPTIONS, PUT, PATCH, DELETE

item.description: A key performance indicator (KPI) is a business metric used to evaluate factors that are crucial to the success of an organization.KPIs give you unique views of practice data that lead to action items to drive increased revenue and save valuable practice time.

item.name: Sikka Payments API

request.description:
#### Accept online payments from your customers.

1. > Practice needs to setup sphere merchant account.
    [Register now](https://www.spherecommerce.com/)

2. > Once your get merchant account id from Sphere. Follow step 3

3. > Log in to Sikka API portal --> API testing tool

request.description:
A sale transaction by credit card is the simplest method to process a complete payment. Upon submission, a Sale transaction attempts an authorization and if approved, schedules capture, which initiates the process that results in funding.


To process transaction with credit card, "transaction_media" must have value "credit_card" as shown below:


"transaction_media": "credit_card" - mandatory to do transaction with credit card.

body.raw:
{
    "request_key": "request_key - mandatory",
    "transaction_media": "ach - mandatory",
    "patient_id": "patient_id - mandatory",
    "guarantor_id": "guarantor_id - mandatory",
    "practice_id": "practice_id - mandatory",
    "cust_id": "cust_id - mandatory",
    "provider_id": "provider_id - mandatory",
    "name": "name - mandatory",
    "zipcode": "zipcode - mandatory",
    "transaction_amount": "transaction_amount(xx.xx) - mandatory",
    "routing_number": "routing_number - mandatory",
    "account_number": "account_number - mandatory",
    "is_savings_account_number": "y OR n - mandatory"
}

request.description:
Automated Clearing House (ACH) is the back-end process through which electronic checks may be processed. ACH is purely a money transfer. ACH "sale" use the same fields as "sale" by "credit_card", with the exception of the "card_number", "expiration_month", "expiration_year" and address verification system (AVS) fields. Instead, they use the following fields: "account", "routing".


To process transaction with ACH, "transaction_media" must have value "ach" as shown below:


"transaction_media": "ach" mandatory to do transaction with ach.

request.description:
> This feature allows merchants to submit a request to Store payment account details and receive a "billing_id". The "billing_id" is a token that can be used as a Cardholder primary account number (PAN) replacement for future one-time and subscription payments.


Each "billing_id" is access controlled such that it can only be used by the merchant who created it and can be stored by the merchant in plain text.


"is_recurring_payments": "false - optional" - if not passed then default value for this parameter "false" will be considered. 


"is_default": "true/false - optional" - if not passed then default value for this parameter "true" will be considered.

Get saved card for patient.

request_key - mandatory

patient_id - mandatory

guarantor_id - mandatory

practice_id - mandatory

startdate - optional (format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss)

enddate - optional (format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss)

billing_id - optional

name - optional - Filters results to transactions referencing the specified cardholder name; includes partial matches.

card_number - optional - Filters results to transactions referencing the specified cc; this can be either the full credit card number or just the last four digits.

transaction_status - optional - possible values - approved, accepted, declined or all (default)

is_active - optional - possible values - true, false or all (default)

is_recurring_payments - optional - possible values - true, false or all (default)

This API will show message of the saved card is marked as inactive/unstore only for given "billing_id".

The card will also available in the GET "store_card" response for "is_active" - "false/all".

request_key - mandatory

billing_id - mandatory

request.description:
Update PUT store_card end point to update only "is_default" flag at our end.

To update "is_default" flag for given "billing_id", "is_update_default" must have value "true" as shown below: 

"is_update_default": "true- mandatory"

Default value for "is_default" is "true", so if you pass "is_update_default"="true", but don't pass "is_default" flag then given "billing_id" will be marked as default and all other saved cards will be marked as "is_default"="false".

request.description:
A sale transaction by saved card is the simplest method to process a complete payment without providing actual credit card details. Upon submission, a Sale transaction attempts an authorization on provided "billing_id" and if approved, schedules capture, which initiates the process that results in funding.


To process transaction with saved credit card, "transaction_media" must have value "billing_id" as shown below:


"transaction_media": "billing_id" - mandatory to do transaction with saved card credit card.

request.description:
> This feature allows merchants to submit a request to Store payment account details with recurring payment plan and receive a "billing_id". The "billing_id" is a token that can be used as a Cardholder primary account number (PAN) replacement for future retrieval.


Each "billing_id" is access controlled such that it can only be used by the merchant who created it and can be stored by the merchant in plain text.


"is_recurring_payments": "true - optional" - if this is for recurring payment then value for this parameter must be passed as "true".

Example:
If merchant want to setup recurring payment for $50.00 for 5 months on monthly basis then request should have values as below:

    "run_cycles": "1"
    "number_of_payments": "5",
    "run_cycle_interval": "m",
    "total_amount": "50.00"

Above values will be considered as 5 installments every 1 month.

request_key - mandatory

patient_id - mandatory

guarantor_id - mandatory

practice_id - mandatory

startdate - optional (format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss)

enddate - optional (format: yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss)

transaction_id - optional

billing_id - optional

name - optional - Filters results to transactions referencing the specified cardholder name; includes partial matches.

card_number - optional - Filters results to transactions referencing the specified cc; this can be either the full credit card number or just the last four digits.

transaction_type - optional - possible values - preauth, sale, credit or all (default)

transaction_status - optional - possible values - approved, accepted, declined or all (default)

transaction_media - optional - possible values - credit_card, ach or all (default)

If request don't have startdate and enddate, then last 30 days records will be retrieved with other given parameters

item.description: Sikka Payments API #### Integrate online payments using the Sikka APIs. #### Overview Sikka Payments API enables healthcare practices to process payments through the secured payment gateway. A payment can be taken from patients. #### Base URL [https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/payment](https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/payment) #### Sandbox URL [https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/sandbox/payment](https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/sandbox/payment) #### PCI Compliance Sikka Software is only responsible for the security of credit card to the extent that it is directly in the route of the payment request to payment processors during a payment processing request. To ensure secure handling of payment instruments, as a third-party developer, you are responsible for developing the front ends in a PCI compliant manner and maintaining a PCI compliance. > NOTE : If your application handles credit card data, you will need to be PCI Compliant. ##### Rules - Non-printable characters, such as CR, LF, and other control characters, must not be submitted. - Spaces at the beginning and end of fields are not preserved; spaces in the middle are preserved. - Dates must be submitted as "YYYY-MM-DD" where "YYYY" is the four-digit year, "MM" is the two-digit month, and "DD" is the two-digit day. For example, February 1, 2015 is submitted as "2015-02-01". #### Testing Your Application - The Sikka Payments API sandbox environment is fully functional and available 24/7. Your Sikka API account in our sandbox environment is available for as long as you want to use it. Many of our API partners / users continue to use the test account for future development projects & evaluation of new products. - If your account is in production (live), you can use : '[https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/payment](https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/payment) - If you want to use our sandbox environment , you can use : [https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/sandbox/payment](https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/sandbox/payment) ##### Sandbox environment data - While testing, you may want to experiment with the different responses that can be generated. The following table provides test card numbers that will produce an approval and includes address data for testing. If you want to test CVV, the code listed in the right-hand column is the correct CVV code. Please note that for these test cards the EXP Date is flexible and can be any future date. ##### Test Cards - Approved | Card Type | Card Number | Exp Date | Address | CVV | | --- | --- | --- | --- | --- | | Visa | 4111111111111111 | 04/2029 | 123 Test St., Somewhere, CA, 90001 | 123 | | MasterCard | 5411111111111115 | 04/2029 | 4000 Main St., Anytown, AZ, 85001 | 777 | | MasterCard | 2223000010020888 | 04/2029 | 4001 Main St., Anytown, AZ 85002 | 657 | | American Express | 341111111111111 | 04/2029 | 12 Colorado Blvd., Elsewhere, IL, 40000 | 4000 | | Discover | 6011000000000012 | 04/2029 | 6789 Green Ave., Nowhere, MA, 12345 | 298 | | Diners Club | 36484444444446 | 04/2029 | 7390 Del Mar Blvd, Anytown, NY, 01101 | 456 | | JCB | 213122222222221 | 04/2029 | 350 Madison Ave., Springfield, OH, 40000 | 281 | The test card numbers from the above table are duplicated below without spaces for use with copy and paste. ``` Visa: 4111111111111111 MasterCard: 5411111111111115 American Express: 341111111111111 Discover: 6011000000000012 Diner's Club: 36484444444446 JCB: 213122222222221 ``` ##### Test Cards - Declined The following card numbers will generate a decline, with the declinetype as listed below. You may use this to test code which takes different paths dependent upon the type of decline. | Card Number | Exp Date | Decline Type | Without Spaces | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | 4012 3456 7890 9 | 04/2029 | decline | 4012345678909 | | 5555 4444 3333 2226 | 04/2029 | call | 5555444433332226 | | 4444 1111 4444 1111 | 04/2029 | carderror | 4444111144441111 | ##### ACH Test Numbers | Routing Number | Account Number | | --- | --- | | 789456124 | 55544433221 | #### Getting started 1. Practice must have sphere merchant account , you need a Sphere merchant account. [Register now](https://www.spherecommerce.com/). 2. After creating account with Sphere ,log into Sikka API Portal 3. Go to API testing tool and select base url ('/payment' for production & '/sandbox' for testing) for payments. 4. Select POST sale API and execute it with required parameters 5. Check response of API. Congratulations! You completed a basic payments integration with the Sikka Payments API.

item.name: Modified Records

request.description:
This api will return what data has been changed in practice between given date range. In response you will get data with flags Deleted , Added & Updated. Response also contains field name , old value and new value of that field. |Parameter|Description|Required?| |--- |--- |--- | |request_key|Valid 32 characters alpha-numeric request key|Yes| |loaded_startdate|Start date for getting only changed record set. Date format : yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss|No| |loaded_enddate|End date for getting only changed record set. Date format : yyyy-MM-dd or yyyy-MM-ddTHH:mm:ss|No| |events|Name of the events you want to get modified records. Events name must match with API name|yes| |interval|Value must be integer.
'interval' parameter allows user to fetch records , which has been changed in last minutes.
This will be helpful when user does not know loaded_startdate/loaded_enddate and just want to fetch records which has been changed in last minutes (let say 5,10,15.. etc minutes). Maximun value for interval is 1440. You can fetch data which has been changed in last 24 hours (1440 minutes, interval=1440) without specifying loaded_startdate and loaded_enddate.
Note : Make sure Sikka platform utility is up and running on client machine. To check when Sikka platform utility (SPU) has refreshed, call 'authorized_practices' and get 'data_insert_date'.|No| ##### API to find change logs of records : To find patient’s modified records : https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/patients?request_key={}&loaded_startdate={}&loaded_enddate={} To find appointments modified records : https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/appointments?request_key={}&loaded_startdate={}&loaded_enddate={} To find transaction’s modified records : https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/transactions?request_key={}&loaded_startdate={}&loaded_enddate={} ##### In practice_events API https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/practice_events?request_key={}&loaded_startdate={}&loaded_enddate={}&events={name_of_the_API_you_want_to_retrieve} For example, if you want to retrieve patients' modified records https://api.sikkasoft.com/v2/practice_events?request_key={}&loaded_startdate={}&loaded_enddate={}&events=patients Response : ```javascript [ { "accounts_receivables": [], "appointments": [], "guarantors": [], "guarantors_v2": [], "patients": [], "pet_nutritions": [], "practices": [], "prescriptions": [], "prescriptions_dental": [], "providers": [], "transactions": [], "treatment_plans": [] } ] ``` ##### When to use practice_events API ? If you want to get list of modified record using one API Don't want to process raw data on your side and just get updated records ##### Recommandation
  • Use it for only one event, rather then passing multiple events in single API call.
  • Use it for short time range. like 24 hrs or less.
  • It will work for maximum 3 days date range but response will be slow and data accuracy will be affected
  • In single call you can fetch changes for maximum 3 days
  • Use either interval and flag or loaded_startdate, loaded_enddate and flag comobination
  • If interval parameter is passed then loaded_startdate and loaded_enddate parameters will not be captured
##### Limitation :
  • If data changed during specified interval is in large scale then response time will be increased
##### Available events : Currently you will be able to get events from
  1. accounts_receivables
  2. appointments
  3. claims
  4. claim_descriptions
  5. guarantors
  6. guarantors_v2
  7. patients
  8. pet_nutritions
  9. practices
  10. prescriptions
  11. prescriptions_dental
  12. providers
  13. transactions
  14. treatment_plans
We will update the list of events as we add in API

The "start" function is used to initiate the communication between the application and Sikka API. It generates a unique requestkey and starts the request session.

|app_key|This is the unique key generated when the application is registered on API portal|Yes|
|office_id|Mastercustomerid, This is the ID assigned to a practice when that practice is added|Yes|
|secret_key|This is the Secrete Key generated for that practice, when practice is added|Yes|

item.description:
Sikka Platform Cloud provides APIs so you can quickly build secure apps
for over 90% of dental, veterinary, audiology and optometry industries.Use our API to gain access to all the opt - in HIPAA / HITECH compliant rich data that a healthcare practice generates.
> Join our Ecosystem and build your own Apps!The Sikka Ecosystem harnesses the power of over 50 unique apps
for you to gain full control of your practice,
while viewing real - time industry metrics, securely - all at your fingertips!
> Visit : [Sikka Marketplace](https://www.sikkasoft.com)

>Note : Certain special characters are not allowed in the API URI path segment (:, #, ?, /, \\, %, +, =)
